channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024010102
item.description:
Report E-2024010102

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4 gallons of Rnew (un3098) released from a 5 gallon pail due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Basin estimates that 4 gallons of product was released due to a nail puncture. Basin has been advised that vented bung cap will be required on the poly waste drum. (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum of waste was created and left at the terminal.

item.title: Report E-2024010027
item.description:
Report E-2024010027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 27, 2023, one (1) 375-gallon tote of UN2693 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement beneath the trailer, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from LoneStar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2693-impacted trailer, dock floor, and asphalt parking lot and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal. LSH personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote to one (1) new 330-gallon tote for further shipment.

item.title: Report X-2023120637
item.description:
Report X-2023120637

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120637 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OTHER PACKAGES IN UNLOAD. IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE A HAZMAT AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: CAPS HAD BEEN LOOSE AND IT WAS NOT PROPERLY PACKED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN TOTE WITH BAG. 2. X-2023120643 SequenceEvent: Package was found at the first IC pull wet and torn open DescribePack: Box was wet and torn open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a red tote with hazmat bag.
